text: Hong Kong has suspended all flights in
and out of the territory as thousands of
anti-government protesters hold a sittin
at the International Airport one of the
world's busiest mass demonstrations and
unrest show no sign of abating more than

controversial extradition bill now many
of those protesting are critical of the
actions of police who on Sunday were
caught on film firing tear gas at close
range in the last hour the Assistant
Commissioner of police operations in
Hong Kong responded to those criticisms
we have a very stringent Aragog
requirements on our officers when using
force and and the decision to use force
is then then our officers to determined
then then what level of force is should
be used in in the present in the and
that act occasions and they should use
the minimum level force to achieve the

been criticised for firing non-lethal

there's never much time before the

generally the protesters retreat

worse
police in his quest conducting at times
